page.title: 02SADBERGE JUBILEE STONE
page.content: In the centre of the village is a Jubilee stone.It was placed there in {June 1887}to commemorate the{Jubilee of{Queen Victoria.}The stone was found when the reservoir in the village was being excavated.On the stone is a metal plaque upon which there is a engraving of{Queen Victoria}riding on a lion, carrying a flag and surrounded by flowers. The stone is 160 cms by 120 cms. This is the wording on the plaque: {This stone was placed here to {commemorate the Jubilee of {Victoria Queen of the United Kingdom, {Empress of Sadberge. June 20th {1887.It was found 12 feet below the {surface in making the reservoir. It {had been detached from the rock in the {west,and deposited by a glacier. By Sara Hart <Aged 11>
